      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Dataset copied from the cd obtained from Washington, DC 2005

Polling Places were identified from lists published by the DC Board of Elections and Ethics web site. A point shapefile was created by geocoding the addresses. These points were compared to the 2002 orthophotographs, the building footprint layer, and the DC Real Property Tax owner points for address and ownership information.  A link to the appropriate web site was provided for reference. The geocoded points were then moved to the center of the corresponding buildings and core attributes were added.  Attribute data was provided by website records.

All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters.</procdesc>
        <procdate>2004</procdate>

            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>

            <cntemail>dcgis@dc.gov</cntemail>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>

        <procdate/>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Polling places updated for the 2004 Election based off of data from BOEE.  For the 2004 election, eighteen changes were identified.  Most were attribute updates, but some involved moving polling places to new locations and attributing them.</procdesc>
        <procdate>10/29/04</procdate>

            <cntvoice/>

      </procstep>

        <procdesc>Metadata imported.</procdesc>
        <srcused>E:\DCGISDATA_WORKSPACE\BOEE\PollingPlacePt_old.shp.xml</srcused>
        <procdate/>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Polling places were updated for the 2006 Election based off of data from BOEE.  For the 2006 election, ten changes were identified.  First, staff updated the attribution.  Then, the layer was geocoded to the Master Address Repository (MAR).</procdesc>
        <procdate>08/29/06</procdate>
